title: 32 Stories - Adrian Tomine - Early Optic Nerve before D and Q
description:
This is a new set of scans of the early days of Optic Nerve.  These are all excellent quality scans about 1500 pixels wide.

------------------------------------------------

Scanner&#039;s Comments:

I think the comparisons to Clowes, while perhaps not completely invalid, are
generally quite overstated.  Like Clowes, Tomine stands alone.  In my opinion
he and Clowes don&#039;t play in the same ball park, but they do play in the same
league.  Wait... what do you care what I think?  You&#039;re here for the scans, not
my editorial drivel.

This book is all material from before Tomine signed with Drawn and Quarterly.
Unless you&#039;ve seen his ancient and rare self-produced comics from the days
before that, this will all be new material to you even though it&#039;s actually
older.  These stories are not in the Drawn and Quarterly comics, at least not
the first 11 issues which is all I have.  The style here is Tomine all the way
even though these stories are rough around the edges.  Literally.  He didn&#039;t
get around to obsessively drawing "every straight line using a ruler" until
Stammer, starting on page 77 of this book.

This is a small format trade paperback, only 5 1/2 inches wide by 8 1/2 inches
high, so I went with 300 dpi for the first time in order to keep the scans nice
and large.  I also cropped the daylights out of some massive whitespace, but
that&#039;s all that got cut.  This is a cover to cover scan of the entire book,
inside and out.

------------------------------------------------

http://www.dvdmadhouse.com/x09236wtm/32stories.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
